text:
Metro Sport Reporter for Metro.co.uk Monday 27 Feb 2017 10:34 pm Liverpool boss Jurgen Klopp (Picture: Getty) 
Jurgen Klopp allowed Mamadou Sakho to leave Liverpool in January in a loan deal that split the views of Reds fans. 
The 27-year-old defender had not featured for Jurgen Klopp all season after falling out of favour at Anfield. Jurgen Klopp sends warning to his Liverpool flops after Leicester loss 
Klopp sent the Frenchman to relegation-battlers Crystal Palace on loan – and many Liverpool fans wish he was still on Merseyside. 
The Reds were comfortably beaten by Leicester City at the King Power Stadium on Monday evening, with Lucas struggling in the centre-back role. 
The Brazilian, naturally a defensive midfielder, was terrorised by a revitalised Jamie Vardy as the Foxes sealed a vital 3-1 win to move outside of the drop zone. Mamadou Sakho joined Crystal Palace on loan (Picture: Getty)
